gov.usgs.anss.console

Class ConsoleConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.console.ConsoleConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ConsoleConnection
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class handles an console connection whether it came into the console server or was created by the ConsoleClient. It maintains the list of all named connections and has the static Map for finding and connection. There is only one console connection for a given name and it persists forever. It can be a client attempting to make a connection to a console, or one that gets created or has its socket reset by the ConsoleServer. Another object can get all of the input from the console by subscribing to it by name. Any object can write to the console using write() though write access should obtain the MUTEX on this object before writing to it.

      • ConsoleConnection

        public ConsoleConnection(java.net.Socket sock,
                         TCPStation tcp,
                         java.lang.String nm)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        set up a new console connection
        Parameters:
        sock - the socket to associate with this connections (generally from ConsoleServer accepts()
        tcp - The TCPStation record for this stations (has IP address etc from database)
        nm - The name to give this socket - station name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a connection by the same name already exists

      • ConsoleConnection

        public ConsoleConnection(java.lang.String ipadr,
                         int pt,
                         TCPStation tcp,
                         java.lang.String nm)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        set up a new console connection - in client mode
        Parameters:
        ipadr - The ip address of the console
        pt - The port on the remote system
        tcp - The TCPStation record for this stations (has IP address etc from database)
        nm - The name to associate with this connection
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if one this is making a connection which already exists(use setConnection() instead)
